sample2.c

00001 /*
00002  * sample.c - The simplest loadable kernel module.
00003  * Intended as a template for development of more
00004  * meaningful kernel modules.
00005  */
00006 
00007 #include <linux/module.h>
00008 #include <linux/kernel.h>
00009 #include <linux/init.h>
00010 #include <linux/fs.h>
00011 #include <asm/uaccess.h>
00012 
00013 /*
00014  * Driver verbosity level: 0->silent; >0->verbose
00015  */
00016 static int sample_debug = 0;
00017 
00018 /*
00019  * User can change verbosity of the driver
00020  */
00021 module_param(sample_debug, int, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
00022 MODULE_PARM_DESC(sample_debug, "Sample driver verbosity level");
00023 
00024 /*
00025  * Service to print debug messages
00026  */
00027 #define d_printk(level, fmt, args...)               \
00028     if (sample_debug >= level) printk(KERN_INFO "%s: " fmt, \
00029                     __func__, ## args)
00030 
00031 /*
00032  * Device major number
00033  */
00034 static uint sample_major = 166;
00035 
00036 /*
00037  * User can change the major number
00038  */
00039 module_param(sample_major, uint, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR);
00040 MODULE_PARM_DESC(sample_major, "Sample driver major number");
00041 
00042 /*
00043  * Device name
00044  */
00045 static char * sample_name = "sample";
00046 
00047 /*
00048  * Device access lock. Only one process can access the driver at a time
00049  */
00050 
00051 static int sample_lock = 0;
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * Device "data"
00055  */
00056 static char sample_str[] = "This is the simplest loadable kernel module!!!! sample.ko\n";
00057 static char *sample_end;
00058 
00059 /*
00060  * Device open
00061  */
00062 static int sample_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00063 {
00064   int ret = 0;
00065 
00066   /*
00067    * One process at a time
00068    */
00069   if (sample_lock ++ > 0) {
00070     ret = -EBUSY;
00071     goto Done;
00072   }
00073   
00074   /*
00075    * Increment the module use counter
00076    */
00077   try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
00078   
00079   /*
00080    * Do open-time calculations
00081    */
00082   sample_end = sample_str + strlen(sample_str);
00083   
00084  Done:
00085   d_printk(2, "lock=%d\n", sample_lock);
00086   return ret;
00087 }
00088 
00089 /*
00090  * Device close
00091  */
00092 static int sample_release(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
00093 {
00094   /*
00095    * Release device
00096    */
00097   sample_lock = 0;
00098   
00099   /*
00100    * Decrement module use counter
00101    */
00102   module_put(THIS_MODULE);
00103   
00104   d_printk(2, "lock=%d\n", sample_lock);
00105   return 0;
00106 }
00107 
00108 /* 
00109  * Device read
00110  */
00111 static ssize_t sample_read(struct file *filp, char *buffer,
00112              size_t length, loff_t * offset)
00113 {
00114   char * addr;
00115   unsigned int len = 0;
00116   int ret = 0;
00117   
00118   /*
00119    * Check that the user has supplied a valid buffer
00120    */
00121   if (! access_ok(0, buffer, length)) {
00122     ret = -EINVAL;
00123     goto Done;
00124   }
00125   
00126   /*
00127    * Get access to the device "data"
00128    */
00129   addr = sample_str + *offset;
00130   
00131   /*
00132    * Check for an EOF condition.
00133    */
00134   if (addr >= sample_end) {
00135     ret = 0;
00136     goto Done;
00137   }
00138   
00139   /*
00140    * Read in the required or remaining number of bytes into
00141    * the user buffer
00142    */
00143   len = addr + length < sample_end ? length : sample_end - addr;
00144   strncpy(buffer, addr, len);
00145   *offset += len;
00146   ret = len;
00147   
00148  Done:
00149   d_printk(3, "length=%d,len=%d,ret=%d\n", length, len, ret);
00150   return ret;
00151 }
00152 
00153 /* 
00154  * Device write
00155  */
00156 static ssize_t sample_write(struct file *filp, const char *buffer,
00157                 size_t length, loff_t * offset)
00158 {
00159   d_printk(3, "length=%d\n", length);
00160   return -EIO;
00161 }
00162 
00163 /*
00164  * Device operations
00165  */
00166 static struct file_operations sample_fops = {
00167   .read = sample_read,
00168   .write = sample_write,
00169   .open = sample_open,
00170   .release = sample_release
00171 };
00172 
00173 static int __init sample_init_module(void)
00174 {
00175   int ret = 0;
00176   
00177   /*
00178    * check that the user has supplied a correct major number
00179    */
00180   if (sample_major == 0) {
00181     printk(KERN_ALERT "%s: sample_major can't be 0\n", __func__);
00182     ret = -EINVAL;
00183     goto Done;
00184   }
00185   
00186   /*
00187    * Register device
00188    */
00189   ret = register_chrdev(sample_major, sample_name, &sample_fops);
00190   if (ret < 0) {
00191     printk(KERN_ALERT "%s: registering device %s with major %d "
00192        "failed with %d\n",
00193        __func__, sample_name, sample_major, ret);
00194     goto Done;
00195   }
00196   
00197  Done:
00198   d_printk(1, "name=%s,major=%d\n", sample_name, sample_major);
00199   
00200   return ret;
00201 }
00202 static void __exit sample_cleanup_module(void)
00203 {
00204   /*
00205    * Unregister device
00206    */
00207   unregister_chrdev(sample_major, sample_name);
00208   
00209   d_printk(1, "%s\n", "clean-up successful");
00210 }
00211 
00212 module_init(sample_init_module);
00213 module_exit(sample_cleanup_module);
00214 
00215 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
00216 MODULE_AUTHOR("Vladimir Khusainov, vlad@emcraft.com");
00217 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Sample device driver");
